p: The production of inflammatory mediators is strongly affected by the AKT, MAPKs, and NF-κB pathways in the RAW264.7 cells. P65 is the major component of the NF-κB activated by LPS in the RAW264.7 cells. As shown in Figure 2, the RAW264.7 cells were pretreated with OEO for 12 h and stimulated with LPS for 1 h. The OEO suppressed the LPS-induced phosphorylation of AKT and MAPKs ( Figure 2a), while decreasing the NF-κB p65 concentration in a dose-dependent manner in the nucleus ( Figure 2b).
